column4: The time and weather in tray area disappeared. How do i get it back it seems to have moved to the panel just to the right of the menu
right clck on panel, -> add to panel
err.. the clock has  a featreu to show the weather also i recall
actually you moved it to the RIGHT of the notification area I imagine. not TO the notification area
the 'tray' is just another special panel widgit.  its moveable
what filesystem was it on? and what device was it?  /dev/sda or /dev/sda1 ? or similer.
It was taken for my dreambox receiver it must be ext2 or 3
was it a whole DISK image? or a partition image?
somthing like 'sudo mount -o loop filename MOUNTPOINT'  is what you need
It gives you must specify fs type in the loop command
so specify it then
if it was ext2 or 3 there is no need to specify it i tried -t ext2 and 3 still giving error wrong fs type
thats whyi asked if it was a DISK image. or a partition Image.. If its a  image of like /dev/sda  - then theres some offset options you may need to give for it to work
This guide sems to cover it -> http://www.andremiller.net/content/mounting-hard-disk-image-including-partitions-using-linux
this is how i created it "cat /dev/mtd/3 > /tmp/backup.img"
No idea on mtd stuff. if its a 'whole' disk image. with several partitions thatn you need to use the offset  options like that URL mentions
try 'testdisk whatever.img' to see some info on teh file
thanks anyhow i will ceck that link
you could put a swap partition on a seperate hd if you wanted.  Depends on your ram. You might never touch your swap.
the icontray thing i think has basically been removed.. i dont think alltray would work at all
but it is already working with other apps i tried it with calculator app ok
monitor yoru ssh ports mainly.
